answers.author: Jayme Bosio
answers.text:
Palm Beach Sheriffs Office staff may utilize language identification posters and booklets to identify language spoke at intake and housing areas. Communications with Limited English Proficiency (LEP) persons is achieved with the following assistance aids; qualified bilingual staff knowledgable in the primary LEP langauge, staff or contract interpreters, "Language Line" (Transparent Language, Inc.) remote service, or using certified court interpreters. Bilingual staff are assessed and tested in Spanish or Creole through the Language Line University for 11 criteria in order to act as an interpreter. (Source: PBSO COP #932.05 Interpreters & Related Services.)

The Prince William County (Va) Criminal Justice Academy is seeking alternatives to provide training to develop Spanish language skills for law enforcement officers in basic and in-service training.  Please send information about any such training programs to:
Captain Alfred E. Miller
Criminal Justice Academy Director
Prince William County Police Dept
13101 Public Safety Drive
Nokesville, VA  20181
Office: 703.792.4525
amiller@pwcgov.org
title: Spanish Language Training for Law Enforcement
